alert.note: Alert for Mobile Coastal (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued March 31 at 5:28AM CDT until April 02 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Mobile Coastal County. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, until 6 PM CDT this evening. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
